Exaggerate: The claim may be seen as exaggerating the role of New York City government in raising the minimum wage to $15, as it implies that the city government's action directly led to the statewide law.
Understate: The claim may understate the role of Governor Andrew Cuomo in initiating the minimum wage increase, as he took the first statewide action on a $15 minimum wage by convening the fast-food wage board.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient support to establish a direct causal link between the actions of New York City government and the passing of the statewide minimum wage increase.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the actions of New York City government were the primary driving force behind the passing of the statewide minimum wage increase, without considering other factors or stakeholders involved.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation for the passing of the statewide minimum wage increase, which is the role of Governor Andrew Cuomo and the actions of the fast-food wage board. This alternative explanation challenges the claim made by Mayor Bill de Blasio.
